intro: Polygonum brownii, commonly known as the brownstem smartweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats and sorrels. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and features simple, alternate leaves that are often reddish or purplish in color. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in dense clusters during the summer months. Polygonum brownii is often found in moist soils along stream banks, wet meadows, and other wetland habitats.
